text: This game was pretty good, the day stages were the best out of all the sonic games (in my opinion) because you go so damn fast. however the werehog was a new twist but it did get boring after awhile because there were more night stages then day stages. also the night stages took awhile to finish, but it was fun.

author: Pedro Martins

text:
Wow, they're really just as bad? I've heard nothing but good things about them from most people I've heard from. I saw some trailers for them and figured they must be on point, but apparently they still leave some to be desired. 

Probably still will check out the DS or Advance games if I get a chance, but seems like Sega should listen to Sonic's advice from Brawl. "C'mon, step it up!"

text: I never notice it. But there is a newspaper behind Sonic on the right. And there's something written there but I can't read it. I don't know... I just wanted to address it. Anyways... MERRY CHRISTMAS EVERYBODY!! ^.^
author: Fransinn3

text:
The day stages are really good, but the night stages really takes the fun away from the game. Well, I myself do like button mashing games (dynasty warriors, samurai warriors, go figure), and I do love the multiple combos you can do to the enemies during the night stages, but..trust me, Werehogs aren't made for platforming.

After all that crap I waded through, I AM looking forward to Project Needlemouse and I just hope that the Sonic Team wouldn't screw up this time.

author: fatmanrock44

text: The reason it gets hate is because it's not what you would expect from a Sonic the Hedgehog game. True, it was probably put in to break the repetitiveness of the day stages, but it ended up working backwards, making players want to see the light, rather play the day stages. Classic Sonic was so refreshing that they didn't want the Werehog stages to drag on as they did.
